comments.text:
Created attachment 525472
Screenshot: AMO permission-to-install-add-on dialog without the option to always allow

Currently, the notification prompted by an add-on install says that  "Firefox has prevented this site from asking you to install software on your computer."  It gives the user the option to "Allow" the site to install, or "Not Now."  "Always Allow" should be a third option on this panel.
comments.creator: jboriss@mozilla.com
comments.raw_text: Currently, the notification prompted by an add-on install says that  "Firefox has prevented this site from asking you to install software on your computer."  It gives the user the option to "Allow" the site to install, or "Not Now."  "Always Allow" should be a third option on this panel.
We basically removed the always allow option in bug 252830 and I'm not sure we want to add it again, especially if we make installations that much easier once in the whitelist.
